GlaxoSmithKline 2012 Neurophysics Workshop on Pharmacological MRI


Talks from the 23 & 24 January 2012 ''GlaxoSmithKline - Neurophysics Workshop on Pharmacological MRI'', an activity hosted at Warwick University and coordinated with the Neurophysics Marie Curie Initial Training Network of which GSK is a participant.

Talks

This section lists GlaxoSmithKline 2012 Neurophysics Workshop on Pharmacological MRI standalone talks by NISOx and NISOx collaborators.
  • Principles of pharmacological modelling relevant to applications of imaging endpoints
    Authors: Chao Chen and Stefano Zamuner. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5487208.v1
  • Identifying fMRI signatures of drug action for the screening of novel compounds
    Author: Eugene Duff. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5488873.v1
  • Weighted Network Analysis for Groups: Separating Differences in Cost from Differences in Topology
    Author: Cedric E. Ginestet. October 2012. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5488876.v1
  • Analysis of longitudinal imaging data
    Author: Bryan Guillaume. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5488879.v1
  • Model Based Analyses Direct and Indirect PK-PD modelling
    Author: Roger Gunn. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5488882.v1
  • Multimodal approaches to functional neuroimaging
    Author: Peter Morris. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5491330.v1
  • Detecting Global Treatment Effects Across ROI
    Authors: George Minas, Fabio Rigat, Thomas Nichols, John Aston, and Nigel Stallard. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5488900.v1
  • Principles of Haemodynamic Coupling for fMRI
    Author: Paul M. Matthews. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5488897.v1
  • ASL Methods and Potential for pHMRI
    Author: Michael Kelly. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5488885.v1
  • BOLD contrast and its measurement
    Author: Rexford Newbould. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5491336.v1
  • Stochastic Dynamic Causal Modelling for resting-state fMRI
    Author: Ged Ridgway. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5492731.v1
  • Network analyses for fMRI
    Author: Petra Vertes. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5492734.v1
  • Pharmacological FMRI: principles and confounds
    Author: Richard Wise. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5492737.v1

Oxford Big Data Institute at the University of Oxford
